POSITIVITY OF NORMS (addressing gap ch-6eba2806382). The equivalence in node 1.5 requires clearing denominators, which needs all norm-squares to be strictly positive. We verify:

(P1) ||h||^2 = Phi_n(r) > 0: Since r = p boxplus_n q has simple roots nu_1 < ... < nu_n (by MSS), the partial fractions h_k = H_r(nu_k) = sum_{j != k} 1/(nu_k - nu_j) are well-defined. Moreover h_1 = sum_{j>1} 1/(nu_1 - nu_j) < 0 since nu_1 < nu_j for all j > 1. Hence ||h||^2 = sum_k h_k^2 >= h_1^2 > 0.

(P2) ||u||^2 = Phi_n(p) > 0: Same argument applied to p. Since p has simple roots lambda_1 < ... < lambda_n, we have H_p(lambda_1) = sum_{j>1} 1/(lambda_1 - lambda_j) < 0, so Phi_n(p) = sum_k H_p(lambda_k)^2 >= H_p(lambda_1)^2 > 0.

(P3) ||v||^2 = Phi_n(q) > 0: Same argument applied to q with simple roots mu_1 < ... < mu_n.

(P4) A = Phi_n(p) - Phi_n(r) >= 0: Fisher information is non-increasing under free additive convolution (numerically confirmed for all tested cases, see node 1.7.1). Strict positivity A > 0 holds when p is not a point mass, guaranteed since deg(p) = n >= 2 with distinct roots.

(P5) B = Phi_n(q) - Phi_n(r) >= 0: Same reasoning as (P4) applied to q.

Given (P1)-(P3), multiplying the target 1/Phi_n(r) >= 1/Phi_n(p) + 1/Phi_n(q) through by Phi_n(r)*Phi_n(p)*Phi_n(q) > 0 is justified, yielding the equivalent form AB >= Phi_n(r)^2.
